li.a: Across the Universe with Jeff Spevak
Across the Universe with Jeff Spevak

div.h1: RCSD expands meal options for kids during the COVID-19 pandemic

div.class: medium-10 medium-pull-1 large-8 large-pull-2 columns post-body-container

img.alt: A child's hands are sprayed with purell prior to receiving a grab and go lunch at an R-Center.

div.div: A child's hands are sprayed with purell prior to receiving a grab and go lunch at an R-Center.

div.p: There are more options coming for kids who need meals in the city of Rochester during the pandemic.Â

Since schools closed in mid March because of COVID-19, Foodlink, the city of Rochester, Monroe County and the Rochester City School District have worked together to serve thousands of meals to kids every weekday.Â
City School Superintendent Terry Dade said theyâ€™ve identified underserved parts of the city and are making adjustments to the program.
â€œWeâ€™re opening four new sites at the Douglass campus, school 8, school 17, and school 45,â€ said Dade.

The sites open up Monday, bringing the number of schools who are offering meals to 12. The city of Rochester is also offering meals at select rec centers. All sites serve grab and go breakfast and lunches. The rec centers serve dinner as well.
A district press release said 81,379 breakfast meals and 98,842 lunch meals would be served as of Thursday.
For more information check out our listing of places to get the meals here.

h2.a: Connections: Rochester City School District Superintendent Terry Dade on his latest draft budget

a.title: Rochester City School District Superintendent Terry Dade on his latest draft budget

div.div: Rochester City School District Superintendent Terry Dade on his latest draft budget

div.p: Rochester City School District Superintendent Terry Dade joins us to discuss the cuts that he says are necessary. We talk teaching positions, buildings, social and emotional support, East High, and more.
The superintendent says it has been a devastating process, but he will make the hard decisions that must be made. Our guest:

ul.li: Terry Dade, Rochester City School District Superintendent
